text: Aung Kyaw Tun () is a former Myanmar international footballer who played as a midfielder. ==International career== Tun became the youngest ever player to feature in a FIFA recognised match, when, at 14 years and 93 days, he made his debut for Myanmar against Thailand in the 2000 Tiger Cup, a record he held for over 10 years before it was broken in November 2011 by Somali player Abdinur Mohamud. He also scored in the match against Thailand, making him the youngest ever international male goalscorer - a record which still stands. Since then, he has accumulated 13 international caps. ==Coaching career== Tun now works as the assistant manager for the Myanmar national under-20 football team. ==Career statistics== === International === {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- !
